name: Avoid PLC Procedures & Functions with more than 100 lines of code (PL1)
description: This rule searches for PLC Functions and PLC Procedures with more than X Lines of Code.
output:
The report lists all the PL1 Functions and PL1 Procedures having more than 100 lines of code.

It provides following information: 
-  PL1 Functions and PL1 Procedures full name
rationale: Artifacts with more than 100 lines of code are generally difficult to maintain.
remediation: Split the procedures and functions in order to not have more than 100 lines of code.
total: Number of PLC Functions and PLC Procedures

technicalCriteria.name: CWE-1080: Source Code File with Excessive Number of Lines of Code

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
